PATIENT_ID: TEST_TRANSMED_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-01-28 02:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-01-28 02:10:00
Category I activation for 22-year-old male, transmediastinal gunshot wound.
GSW to chest with suspected mediastinal traversal.
Entry wound right anterior chest, exit wound left posterior chest.
Entry and exit wound locations documented.
BP 80/50, HR 135, RR 28, SBP 80. Hemodynamically unstable.
No cardiac arrest. Signs of life present: blood pressure present,
respiratory effort present.

[IMAGING] 2026-01-28 02:25:00
Portable chest x-ray: bilateral hemothorax. CXR obtained.
CT chest with contrast obtained: transmediastinal trajectory confirmed.
Mediastinal widening present. No pericardial effusion.
No pulse differential noted.
Pneumothorax left side. Hemothorax bilateral.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-01-28 02:40:00
Transmediastinal trajectory confirmed on imaging.
Witnessed signs of life confirmed. No cardiac arrest.
Hemodynamic status documented. BP 80/50, HR 135.
Bilateral chest tubes placed. MTP activated.
Patient taken to OR for emergent thoracotomy.
Esophageal imaging deferred â€” operative management pursued.

[OPERATIVE_NOTE] 2026-01-28 03:30:00
Left anterolateral thoracotomy performed. Aortic injury identified and repaired.
Bilateral hemothorax evacuated. Hemostasis achieved.
